intro: Malouetia killipii, commonly known as the Malouetia killipii, is a rare shrub native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
